lessons.title: History of the Web
lessons.content:
The Evolution of the Web

The Web began as a simple document-sharing system created by Tim Berners-Lee in 1989. It evolved from static HTML pages (Web 1.0) into dynamic and interactive experiences (Web 2.0), and now includes decentralized and AI-powered technologies (Web 3.0).

  • Web 1.0 – Static pages
  • Web 2.0 – Social & Interactive
  • Web 3.0 – Decentralized & Intelligent

Exercise: Research the difference between HTTP and HTTPS.

lessons.title: Client vs Server Architecture
lessons.content:
In web development, the client is the browser and the server is the machine that stores and processes data.

Client → Request → Server → Response → Client

Examples of servers: Apache, Nginx, Node.js.

lessons.title: Semantic HTML
lessons.content:
Semantic HTML introduces meaning to your markup using tags like <article>, <section>, <header>, <footer>.

This improves accessibility and SEO.

lessons.title: Forms & Validation
lessons.content:
Forms collect user data using input fields.

<form>
  <input type='email' required />
</form>

HTML5 includes built-in validation attributes like required, pattern, minlength.

lessons.title: Variables & Data Types
lessons.content:
JavaScript variables can be declared using var, let, or const.

let name = 'John';
const age = 25;

lessons.title: Linear Regression Mathematics
lessons.content:
Linear regression models the relationship between X and Y using:
